Package com.ibm.streams.management.resource

Interface ResourceMXBean

public interface ResourceMXBean
ResourceMXBean provides attributes, operations, and notifications for managing a Streams resource for running Streams services, jobs or both.

ObjectNameBuilder.resource(String, String) can be used to build the ObjectName for a ResourceMXBean.

Notifications:
A ResourceMXBean supports sending the following notifications:

javax.management.AttributeChangeNotification.ATTRIBUTE_CHANGE
Only a subset of the attributes support attribute change notification. A note is included in the attribute description for each attribute that supports attribute change notification

Notifications.RESOURCE_ADDED
Notifications.RESOURCE_REMOVED
Notifications.RESOURCE_TAG_ADDED
Notifications.RESOURCE_TAG_REMOVED
Notifications.SERVICE_STARTED
Notifications.SERVICE_STOPPED

Notification categories:
These categories can be used with notification filters to easily filter out all notifications in a category.
Notifications.RESOURCE_NOTIFICATION
Notifications.SERVICE_NOTIFICATION

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Interface
    Description
    static enum 
    ResourceMXBean.SchedulerStatus
    Enumeration for the availability to place processing elements (PEs) of Streams jobs on the resource for an instance.
    static enum 
    ResourceMXBean.Status
    Enumeration for the current status of the resource.

  • Method Details

    • getDisplayName

      String getDisplayName()
      Returns the display name for the resource. This name could the same or different than the resource identifier.
      Returns:
      the resource display name
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

    • getDomain

      String getDomain()
      Returns the name of the domain to which the resource has been added.
      Returns:
      the domain name for the resource.

    • isDomainServiceResource

      boolean isDomainServiceResource()
      Indicates whether the resource is used to run domain management services.
      Returns:
      true if the resource runs domain management services
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.

    • getExclusiveInstance

      String getExclusiveInstance()
      Returns the identifier of the instance to which the resource is allocated if the resource is exclusively allocated to an instance; otherwise, it returns null.
      Returns:
      the instance identifier.

      String getId()
      Returns the unique identifier for the resource within the domain.
      Returns:
      the resource identifier.

    • getResourceSpecification

      ResourceSpecification getResourceSpecification(String instance)
      Returns the resource specification used to select this resource as a candidate for running services, jobs or both for a specified instance.
      Parameters:
      instance - identifies the instance containing the resource.
      Returns:
      ResourceSpecification the resource specification used to select the resource or null if a resource specification was not used to select this resource to be included in the instance.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      NullPointerException - if instance is null.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

    • getRestrictedTags

      Set<String> getRestrictedTags()
      Returns the names of the restricted resource tags assigned to the resource. Only processing elements (PEs) which require this set of resource tags are allowed to run on the resource. The restricted resource tags are the same or a subset of the tags assigned to the resource.
      Returns:
      the restricted resource tag names for the resource.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

    • getSchedulerStatus

      ResourceMXBean.SchedulerStatus getSchedulerStatus(String instance)
      Returns an indicator of the ability of the resource to be used to run processing elements (PEs) of Streams jobs for a specified instance.

      Note: Attribute change notification is supported for this attribute. The user data of the notification is the ObjectName of the instance for which the scheduler status changed.

      Parameters:
      instance - identifies the instance for which the scheduler status is retrieved.
      Returns:
      the scheduler status of the resource for the instance.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      NullPointerException - if instance is null.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

    • getStatus

      ResourceMXBean.Status getStatus()
      Returns the status of domain services on the resource.

      Note: Attribute change notification is supported for this attribute.

      Returns:
      the domain service status on the resource.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.

    • getStatus

      ResourceMXBean.Status getStatus(String instance)
      Returns the status of instance services on the resource for a specified instance.

      Note: Attribute change notification is supported for this attribute. The user data of the notification is the ObjectName of the instance for which the status changed.

      Parameters:
      instance - identifies the instance for which the resource status is retrieved.
      Returns:
      the instance service status on the resource for the instance.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      NullPointerException - if instance is null.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

    • getType

      String getType()
      Returns the resource type for the resource. Some possible values are:
      • RESOURCE_TYPE_STREAMS
      Returns:
      the resource type.

    • createOperationListener

      ObjectName createOperationListener()
      Creates an OperationListenerMXBean for tracking status messages associated with operations invoked on this bean. Once the operation listener is created, the listener Id can be passed as a parameter on operations which support it. An operation listener can be reused for multiple operation invocations; however, the behavior is undefined if it is used for concurrent operations. All existing messages are cleared at the start of each operation for which the listener is used. The unregister operation should be called on the operation listener after the listener is no longer needed to free the associated memory. All operation listeners are automatically unregistered when the monitored bean is unregistered. An operation listener is also automatically unregistered if it has had no activity for a certain amount of time. The inactivity time is controlled by the JMX_INACTIVITY_TIMEOUT property and is set to 30 minutes by default. If an operation listener bean is needed again, a new one can be created.
      Returns:
      the object name of the created listener bean.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.

    • getJobs

      Set<BigInteger> getJobs(String instance)
      Returns the set of active jobs running on the resource for the specified instance and for which the current user has read permission.
      Parameters:
      instance - identifies the instance for which the active jobs are retrieved.
      Returns:
      the active jobs running on the resource for specified instance.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

      Throws:

      NullPointerException - if instance is null.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

    • isTagInUseByAnyJob

      boolean isTagInUseByAnyJob(String tag)
      Identifies whether any PEs placed on this resource for any instance require the specified resource tag.
      Parameters:
      tag - identifies the name of the resource tag to check for use.
      Returns:
      the usage indicator for the resource tag.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      NullPointerException - if tag is null.

    • isTagInUseByAnyJob

      boolean isTagInUseByAnyJob(String tag, String instance)
      Identifies whether any PEs placed on this resource, for a specific instance, require the specified resource tag.
      Parameters:
      tag - identifies the name of the resource tag to check for use.
      instance - identifies the instance for which the resource tag is checked for use.
      Returns:
      the usage indicator for the resource tag.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      NullPointerException - if instance is null.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

    • quiesce

      boolean quiesce(boolean force, String listenerId)
      Stop all services and jobs running on the resource.
      Parameters:
      force - indicates whether the quiesce operation should be run even if required services are running on the resource and there are no waiting services of the same type.
      listenerId - identifies an operation listener created using createOperationListener. Status messages relating to the progress of this operation are added to the listener as the operation runs. Any existing messages contained in the listener are cleared before the operation starts. If the value is null, this parameter is ignored.
      Returns:
      true if the resource was quiesced or false if the quiesce operation timed out or the resource was not running.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if an operation listener does not exist for the specified listenerId.
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

    • resume

      boolean resume(String listenerId)
      Restarts services on the resource after the resource has been quiesced.
      Parameters:
      listenerId - identifies an operation listener created using createOperationListener. Status messages relating to the progress of this operation are added to the listener as the operation runs. Any existing messages contained in the listener are cleared before the operation starts. If the value is null, this parameter is ignored.
      Returns:
      true if the resource was resumed or false if the resume operation timed out or the resource was not quiesced.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if an operation listener does not exist for the specified listenerId.
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

    • retrieveDomainServices

      List<DomainServiceMXBean.Type> retrieveDomainServices()
      Returns the list of domain services running on the resource. If a service is started multiple times on the resource, it is occurs in the list multiple times.
      Returns:
      the domain service list.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

    • retrieveInstallations

      Map<String,VersionInformation> retrieveInstallations()
      Returns installation path and version information for each Streams installation on the resource.
      Returns:
      the installation information.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

    • retrieveInstanceServices

      List<InstanceServiceMXBean.Type> retrieveInstanceServices(String instance)
      Returns the list of services running on the resource for a specific instance. If a service is started multiple times on the resource, it is occurs in the list multiple times.
      Parameters:
      instance - identifies the instance for which the service list is returned.
      Returns:
      the instance service list.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      NullPointerException - if instance is null.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.

    • retrieveMetrics

      Set<Metric> retrieveMetrics()
      Retrieves the metric information and values for the resource. A metric is a measurement of an element associated with the resource.
      Returns:
      the set of metrics for the resource.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.
      See Also:
      • Metric
      • InstanceMXBean.retrieveJobSystemMetricMetadata()

    • retrievePeRestartPriorities

      Map<BigInteger,PeMXBean.RestartPriority> retrievePeRestartPriorities(String instance, int resourceLoadThreshold)
      Retrieves the recommended processing element (PE) restart priorities for PEs running on the resouce.
      Parameters:
      resourceLoadThreshold - specifies the resource threshold value to use when determining the priorities. The value is interpreted as follows:
      • greater than 0 - use the value exactly
      • -1 or less than -3 - use the value specified in the instance configuration
      • -2 - use the average for all resources in the instance
      • -3 - use the middle resource average as the threshold
      Returns:
      the restart priorities for the PEs running on the resource.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the operation is unable to complete successfully.
      NullPointerException - if instance is null.
      SecurityException - if the current user does not have the required permissions to perform the operation. Information about Streams permissions can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Security objects for Teracloud Streams domains and instances.
